intro: Sphaeralcea dregeana, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to reduce water loss. Sphaeralcea dregeana is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats.
